creator: rj180

content:
I suggest you move back to oauth. Normal password, just do not work going forward. That is a choice of Google, not the Thunderbird folk. If you have two factor authentication, you might have to disable it while you add your account, but having it working you should be able to simply change to oauth and it will step you through the process of authenticating.

Right click the folder you are having issues with (except the italic ones) and in properties make sure you are set to include the folders when getting mail.

Check in your google settings here https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0/#settings/labels that the specific labels are enabled to show in IMAP. Not all are.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Non ho idea di che guida tu stia citando, ma quella voce dell'editor serve ad ordinare le cartelle non i messaggi.

Se guardi la lista dei messaggi, troverai in cima una riga con i nomi delle diverse colonne. Clicca una o due volte sulla colonna Data per cambiare l'ordinamento
creator: @next

content: First, There is no ticket system for Thunderbird. You probably filed for support on the site for fee-paid services, which does not include Thunderbird. Second, I suggest you just reinstall thunderbird to stabilize where you are and then report issues. (Note: I do not understand the 32-bit x64 comment.)
creator: davidsk

content: I suggest doing a backup first of the profile. If using Windows, that would be at c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird (not generally needed, but I like being safe.) Now download and install thunderbird. It will overlay any remaining remnants. I have no idea what may have deleted the prior version, possibly an antivirus program?
creator: davidsk

content: You're welcome, but if you are using an antivirus, I suggest seeing if it is the culprit. Some such software removes software without notifying the user, and that seems to be happening to you. A possibility is to see how to exclude some programs from being monitored. I wish you well.
creator: davidsk
